intro: Ixora viridifora, commonly known as the green-leaved ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Ixora viridifora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
